docs.abstract: New Yorkers for Parks survey finds conditions of more than 40 large parks in city have improved in last two years, though lack of resources and consistency remain; finding is in report card by advocacy group that gave city's parks a B-plus, up from B two years ago.

headline.seo: Problems Remain, but N.Y.C. Parks Receive High Grades in Survey
headline.main: B-Plus for City’s Parks, but Problems Remain
headline.print_headline: B-Plus for City’s Parks, But Problems Remain

docs.snippet: DORAL, Fla. — On the second hole Sunday at the Blue Monster,  Tiger Woods  drained a 19-foot putt for birdie. When at last the applause died down, Graeme McDowell stood over a 7-footer for birdie that suddenly looked twice as long. He rolle...
docs.lead_paragraph:
DORAL, Fla. — On the second hole Sunday at the Blue Monster, Tiger Woods drained a 19-foot putt for birdie. When at last the applause died down, Graeme McDowell stood over a 7-footer for birdie that suddenly looked twice as long. He rolled it in to remain three strokes behind Woods, and as he walked off the green, he made eye contact with a friend and said, “We’re not playing for second place here.”
 
McDowell’s mettle was moving, albeit misplaced. McDowell, who opened with a birdie, could be forgiven for believing that pluck could pull him through in a final-round duel against Woods. At the 2010 World Challenge, McDowell came from four strokes back, the same deficit he faced at Sunday’s start, to tie Woods, whom he then dispatched in a playoff.
docs.abstract: Tiger Woods wins his 76th PGA Tour title at Cadillac Championship, his first World Golf Championships event since 2009. Photos, Chart (M)

headline.main: No Catching Or Doubting A Healthy, Happy Woods

docs.snippet: Tiger Woods moved closer to getting back on top of his sport by claiming his 76th PGA Tour title and first World Golf Championships event since 2009....
